result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Robert L. Collins

records.addlTxt: Scheduling conference on November 16, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Scheduling conference on September 7, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Scheduling conference on August 3, 2022 at 10:15 am.

ADDRESS INFO for Robert L. Collins
Current: 7624 Cty Road T, Whitelaw, WI 54247 United States  (Effective: 06-09-2022)
Prior: 976 County Road T, Whitelaw, WI 54247

BAIL HEARING - 
Defendant in custody on bench warrant and appearing by video from the Manitowoc County Jail. The matters are continued for a scheduling conference on 8-3-2022 at 10:15am in Br. 2.  $1500 recognizance bond previously furnished is continued with the condition that he must maintain absolute sobriety from alcohol and drugs and that he have no contact with Walmart. Def. is remanded into custody on another matter. 
Bench warrant with service of officer thereon.
Minutes.
Warrant served.
DEFENDANT IS TO BE REMANDED TO THE JAIL. DEFENDANT IS TO BE DENIED BY PUBLIC DEFENDER FOR SPECIAL BAIL APPEARANCE. DEFENDANT MUST REPORT IMMEDIATELY TO THE JAIL FOR BOOKING.

1:12 PM Defendant Robert L. Collins not in court.  Attorney Gail Ann Prost appeared by video for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Brian David Van Ells appeared by video for Robert L. Collins. 
The defendant fails to appear for today's scheduling conference. The defendant was required to appear in person today. State requests a warrant.
The Court authorizes a warrant for the defendant.
Defendant is to be denied by Public Defender for special bail appearance and must report to the jail for booking.
Notice of Hearing returned as undeliverable. Unable to forward.
Scheduling conference on May 26, 2022 at 01:00 pm.

records.addlTxt:
1:45 pm - Prosecuting attorney Gail Ann Prost appeared in court for the State of Wisconsin, Defendant Robert L. Collins appeared by video, Attorney Brian David Van Ells appeared by video for Robert L. Collins. Defendant waives their right to a preliminary hearing.  Defendant is bound over to Circuit Court Branch 2 for trial.

Information filed.  Copy served on defense counsel.
Not guilty plea(s) entered.  Jury calendar.
Offer deadline: 04-08-22

Further proceedings on April 8, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Preliminary hearing on March 2, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

1:39 pm - Prosecuting attorney Angelina R Scarpelli appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin, Defendant Robert L. Collins not in court, Attorney Brian David Van Ells appeared by video for Robert L. Collins. 
At 2:05 pm - the case is recalled.  Defendant is now present, by zoom.  All other parties present by zoom.  Preliminary hearing demanded.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 2, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Initial appearance is reset to 02-21-22 at 1:30 p.m. to allow defendant time to talk with counsel.   
Minutes.
Brian Van Ells, through public defender.
RE:  Possess Fentanyl, on 01-05-22.
Order for Prints.

Order to Seal Probable Cause Statement.
The original document was titled: Probable cause statement /judicial determination
The original history event date is: 01-11-2022

BAIL HEARING - 
Defendant in custody and appearing by video from the Manitowoc County Jail.  The State informs the Court that the defendant will be charged with the crimes of  possess Fentanyl, retail theft and bail jumping.  The matters are continued for initial appearance on 02-14-22 at 1:30 p.m. Br. 2.  Bail is set at $1,500.00 recognizance bond with the conditions that he have no contact with Walmart and maintain absolute sobriety from alcohol and drugs.  Bail furnished and defendant is released from custody. Court orders photos and prints at MTPD.
Minutes.
